data.title: Awesome movie theatre
data.text: Saw finding dory at this theater with my two young kids.  It was very clean and the seats were all stadium seating.   Attendants were helpful and cheery. Great movie experience.

data.title: Now called the AMC Woodbridge 5 Theater...
data.text: When you hear that a movie theater plays movies for $1.99 the mental image portrayed might be seedy or dirty. But I can tell you that is false. This theater was formally named the Starplex Cinemas in Irvine, CA but it has since been taken over by the AMC chain. Every week you may get one or even two new movies coming here. I think the movies are maybe about 2 months out of "regular" theaters before hitting this place. That's not too bad at all. We all lead busy lives so there is a chance you might have missed these movies when they were in theaters the first time. This is a great place to catch up on your movies...plus you can't beat the price of just $1.99 per person. My family of four normally pays about $50 just in admission to go to a regular theater. What do we pay now? Just $7.96!! Sure the popcorn and sodas still cost the normal higher price but with the money you save it doesn't hurt as much. Do yourself a favor and save some money!!

data.title: Great bargain and good movies
data.text: Today,I took my grandson to see a children's movie. I didn't feel like I was being robbed. We had a great time. There was a full house on this school holiday. Everyone seemed to be having fun. We sure did.

data.title: Cheap Prices, but Run Down Facility
data.text: This place is the way to go if on a budget. For three adults, the tickets were a total of $12 for an evening movie! They tend to play older films which have been released for awhile. We saw the Martian (which by the way was excellent) and this had been out since before thanksgiving. The facility itself is old and needs some updating. The theater itself lacks proper tiering of its seats, so don't sit behind tall people. The seats are comfy, but the people I went with felt the theater was "dirty." The entire chain just got bought by Regal, so expect upgrades soon!

data.title: A bargain in our midst!
data.text: This movie theater is old, tired, and yet it provides a chance to see movies before they are no longer available at a very minimal cost.  This theater attracts lots of families, they seem to get many films appropriate for kids.  If ambiance is not your family's priority then this will be a treasure.

data.title: Inexpensive movies
data.text:
Starplex Cinemas in Irvine provide a cheap way to view popular movies for a dollar or two. You won't find movies just released, but who wants to fight those crowds? If you can wait a few weeks, you can watch new movies for a fraction of what it cost just a few weeks previously. 
Admittedly, the theater itself doesn't have that "new theater smell". It's been well worn...but it's not bad and worth the price to be entertained for a few hours.

data.title: Terrific value
data.text:
Have been going here for several years.

It's second run movies that we'd missed when they first came out.

Facility is clean and staff is polite.  Other folks in audience are quiet so it's an easy viewing experience.

data.title: Hidden Treasure  in Woodbridge
data.text: Fun place to see older movies. No stadium seating, just your basic movie theatre for movies that are ready to hit red box. $1.00 hot dogs if that's what you like. I like going Mon-Thursday. Weekends is usually packed. I especially like going for the last film of the night when there aren't too many people around.

data.title: Second run movies!
data.text: Fun place to visit in case you missed the films the first time around before they are out on DVD.  And great prices!

data.title: Dollar theatre - what's not to love?
data.text: I repeat, what's not to love? Occasionally the films may start out out of focus, but usually the staff are very attentive and it gets fixed before you can bother to get up and say anything. Also, there's a great sweet shop next door.;)

data.title: Good old fashioned fun
data.text: Cheap movies. Not first run but if you wait you can spend $2 for a movie. Concessions are expensive but they are wverywhere else.

data.title: Great value for movies
data.text: If you missed a movie on its initial run this is a great oppuninity to see it. It's only $2 for a standard movie during the day, small up charge for 3d, and on Thursdays it's only $1! Go during the week in the daytime and there's hardly anyone there. I feel comfortable bringing my smaller kids because they aren't very crowded usually and if we have to end up walking away I'm not out that much money!

data.title: Pinching Pennies?
data.text: This used to be a Regal theater, and is now the dollar theater.  Yep...only $2 to get in.  The movies are a bit older, but if you missed them, this is the place to go.  A Barnes & Noble and some delicious restaurants (including Ruby's) are in the center.

data.title: Good Movies, Plentiful Parking, Low Prices
data.text:
The Woodbridge theater is in the middle of a shopping center with a Barnes & Noble and other shops and medical services. There is plenty of parking for all.

What is most attractive is the price of the movies here: $3 (no senior discount--who needs it!?).

Just go.

data.title: Bargin Price movie theater
data.text: 2$ matinee and 3$ evening shows.  New releases after they leave the big theaters.  Great bargin to bring the whole family.  Theater seats are not high backed like AMC but for 3$ thats ok!  The place is a bit old and in need of renovations.

data.title: Movies at a discount
data.text: Traveling gets to be expensive so when we spotted this theater in nearby Irvine it was the perfect opportunity for the family to take in a movie without it costing over $100. This is how movie going should be.

data.title: Nice neighborhood 'cheapie' movie house
data.text: We live in Irvine, and love this place....when our children were younger they could walk to it in safety along the Irvine paths, and they still come here on dates.  My husband and i particularly like that there is usually a good mixture of kid-themed and more adult movies, generally 2nd run, and you simply can't beat the prices ($2-$4)!  Yes, they do have 3D sometimes, too, if you enjoy that.  It is often crowded, but most patrons are polite and reasonable.  The concession stand has approx. the same prices as do more expensive theaters, but it' not so bad considering the admission being so low.  Usually very clean, except perhaps after a  real kid movie....several choices every week.  A plus:  if you've put off going to a 1st run of a film because timing was wrong, you get another shot in a nice venue in a safe location, with mostly decent patrons.

data.title: Budget Movies in Irvine
data.text: This place is great, go see the movies a few weeks after general release and see them in 2D or 3D for a fraction of the main stream cinema prices.  Often take the kids to see movies multiple times or maybe go to see a movie that takes your fancy, but not want to see it enough to pay $12 a ticket.  This place is a steal with $2 tickets (extra for 3D) !!

data.title: 2 dollars for movie
data.text:
The advantages are below
Is in a good neighborhood and mall.
The price is 2 /3 per person.
The movie screen and sound is good.
You get see pretty recent movies (2 to 3 months old).
The food is cheap.
Also next to park and you can go for a walk. 
I watch at least 4 movies every month here.

data.title: If you are looking for luxury, not the right one!
data.text:
This place offers 2-4 $ movie tickets! sure it's an old cinema but it's fine!
Also hot dogs for 1$? definitley a deal!
